result.execSummary:
The defendant Anita Marie Steele was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample; pay DNA surcharge. Pay all applicable court costs, surcharges and fees by 03-30-17, or to be docketed as a civil judgment/tax intercept.
- Restitution set at 0 (zero).

STRAIGHT TIME, Defendant eligible for the Day Reporting Center. Court has no objection to electronic monitoring. Defendant to report by 04-05-16 by 5pm.
- Defendant to have No Contact with any Pick N Save.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anita Marie Steele

records.addlTxt: Correction to clerical error from 3/30/2016 sentencing hearing. NO STRAIGHT TIME.

records.descr: Request and Order to Correct Clerical Error in JOC

records.addlTxt: Letters in support of Anita Marie Steele, received and filed.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

The Court ordered defendant to serve 5 months in the House of Correction, with credit for 2 days time served, STRAIGHT TIME. The court orders defendant eligible for the Day Reporting Center. 

The court has no objection to electronic monitoring.

* Defendant to have no contact with any Pick N Save.
* Restitution set a 0 (zero).
* Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.
* Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs, surcharges and fees by 3/30/2017, or to be docketed as a civil judgment/tax intercept.

Defendant to report by 4/5/2016 by 5:00 p.m.

Received and filed:  
Notice of right to seek postconviction relief;
Sentencing Referral Form.

Defendant Anita Marie Steele in court with attorney Angel Lee Johnson.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for calendar call.

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined by the court as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Attorney Angel Lee Johnson in court.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until a Calendar Call / Projected Guilty Plea and Sentencing in Branch 21.  Calendar call scheduled for March 30, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Anita Marie Steele in court with attorney Angel Lee Johnson.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Received discovery and offer.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Anita Marie Steele in court with attorney Angel Lee Johnson.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is having car problems and lives in Whitewater.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until a Calendar Call.  Calendar call scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Anita Marie Steele
Current: 370 N Tratt Street #104, Whitewater, WI 53190 United States  (Effective: 01-17-2016)
Prior: 139 South Grand Avenue, Waukesha, WI 53186

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Pick N Save Store- 1818 W National Ave
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Anita Marie Steele in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Anita Marie Steele in custody.  
Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: sm  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Michelle Ackerman Havas, Branch 45.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.

  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
